description:
I love this place. It's truly a hidden gem off Union Square. It's tiny, cozy, wonderfully decorated, excellent service and exquisite food. I've been here several times and they've never missed. 

My advice is definitely to get a reservation bc it's so small and it fills up quickly.  You won't be disappointed!
author: Holly C.

description:
Really really good. The chef knows his food. Menu was small but options for everyone. I had a vegetarian dinner there and all  the food was really good. Best of all they are open till midnight!!!

Fantastic. 

Overall really friendly and delicious food.
author: Carlos G.

description:
In a word: Amazing. 

From the service to the food, everything was top notch. We ordered the chickpea fries, two different entrees, and shared the creme fraiche w/ dolce de leche dessert, and everything tasted amazing. 

Reservations definitely recommended, as the space is pretty small. Also, if you ask your server for wine recommendations, they do keep what you order in mind and will make a rec based on what would pair well with your food. Our server made a great recommendation, and we easily finished our bottle of wine.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Love the vibe of this place. Feels cozy, yet it's not that small. There's an upstairs that also has huge windows, offering a nice view of the street. Loved everything we ordered. Small portions, but very tasty. A shared appetizer and 2 entrees were perfectly filling. Patient, friendly staff. Makes you feel right at home. The great part ... they open late on weeknights!!
author: Ali R.

description:
Woohoo! I finally got to try Bouche after eyeing it on Yelp for years. I met up with a friend who happened to suggest Bouche for dinner and it was an excellent choice. He lives nearby and had been there several times before. He explained that they have a small, rotating menu and each item on the menu is reliably tasty. 

I'm glad he made a reservation because the second floor dining space is very small. On a hot day, the space was also rather warm and the first thing I did upon sitting was to open the window behind me. I was concerned that other diners would object to the street noise but instead everyone else complimented me on the idea and opened the other window as well.

Ordering was simple since there were only 4 entree choices. He went for the steak (medium rare) and I had the shiitake mushroom risotto. He looked at me in confusion, as I am generally a carnivore. But I have a soft spot for risotto and I love shiitake mushrooms and didn't mind getting the "vegetarian" option this time. I was not disappointed when the delicious meal came out. We chatted about life and before I knew it, both of our plates were completely empty.

Although we didn't "need" dessert, we decided to share a Creme Fraiche custard. It was served with a mini bowl of butterscotch and had the perfect balance between the subtleness of creme fraiche and the sweetness of the butterscotch.

For the food quality and the convenient central location, Bouche is definitely 5*.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Very small dining space, we ate at the small counter by the door and it was nice.

The bartender was also the host and our server. He was so nice and friendly! 

Hubs and I shared the salad, Brussels Sprouts, and foie gras as starters and also shared the hearty risotto. The server chilled our wine in this cute ice "bag" instead of a traditional bucket, it made us smile. Very cute!

The space is warm and inviting. I would definitely dine here again. I was a bit worried sitting by the door but it was actually nice to people watch :).
author: Kat A.

description:
After one experience at Bouche, it's going on my list of favorite restaurants in the city! Reading though the reviews, I had some hesitations - talk about limited menu, lackluster flavor on some of the dishes, etc. I was blown away at everything I ate! And the service was just what you'd expect from a place with only 6 tables.

I've gotta say, recently went to Bouchon (Michelin Star french restaurant in Yountville), and this was better in every way - food, atmosphere, and service.

Ok, so as far as what I had to eat, all of which I recommend: Bacon bread, Brussels Sprouts, lamb belly, and hangar steak w/fois gras (don't think they do this every night). All fantastic!
author: Derrick S.

description: Great food but slightly over priced. We walked here from our hotel up the street and even though the menu seemed limited without helpful descriptions, the food was a pleasant surprise. The ambiance definitely felt very Parisian. Recommended to anyone looking for non traditional french cuisine and a nice glass of wine.
author: Neda P.

description: Cozy French bistro near union square, good for groups of two but wouldn't recommend anything larger. The food had its ups and downs, but overall we enjoyed it and appreciated the kind service. The disclaimer is to make sure you get a full description of the menu item, for example sweet bread is not bread, but something much more exotic...
author: Riley S.

description:
This is my third time at Bouche, and it's still amazing.

We came here with a reservation, albeit an hour before, and were still seated immediately. The staff is so incredibly kind and fun (they joked about not providing good service because we walked in with a PSG jacket). Our waiter was awesome, to say the very least.

The meal was fantastic, and it's good to note that their menu does change seasonally.

The atmosphere is intimate and cozy, which makes for a great date night. My favorite spot is their upstairs dining room, which is incredibly small with about 6 tables, but so cute and cozy.

Obviously, I'll be returning again and again whenever I'm in the city.
author: Nina V.

description: This place is a true gem, with impeccable food and the best service I ever encountered in this country.
author: Stefan H.

description: Small crowded and loud restaurant which has 2 floors and serves pretty good french food. I had french beer and got  the crispy pork belly, polenta and sausage which were all good.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Perfect setting for any occasion. Customer service is fantastic. 
If you're looking for consistent gourmet food and great wine, this is your place.
author: G G.

description:
This place is a total hidden gem in Union Square. I've been twice now and have been very satisfied with the meal each time. 

The ambiance, food, and service are all transportive--evoking a tiny Parisian neighborhood bistro. Good wines by the glass, usually foie gras on the menu, solid entree options, and strong desserts.
author: Sam R.

description: Small menu with exceptional tastes. Late night still gives the same experience. We felt like we found a hidden gem.
author: Mitzi S.

description:
OMG. This is the best dining experience I have ever had. This is such a cute authentic French bistro. Very cozy and love the second floor view outside. The waiters speak French and a lot of the people eating around us spoke french too. That added such a quality to the meal, such a fun and unique experience. 

I take some french classes and love French cuisine and was able to practice my French here which is great. 

Get the bread with bacon! The best bread, so fluffy and buttery and tasted like it was baked with love. 

All the ingredients are super fresh and delicious. Had the scallop crudo. Raw scallops were very good, first time I had a dish like that. Couldn't eat all of it, too much raw fish for me. They give a good portion. Luckily I had someome to share it with :)

The salmon entree was also delicious and cooked perfectly and paired well with the lentils. 

First time I had a cheese platter for dessert too and I am so glad we got it. They really know thier bread and cheese of course! Tastes just like if I was in Paris. I dont know what type of cheese it was but it was perfectly stiff and creamy at the same time and the honey and apples with it really completed the flavor profile especially with the bread they give you as well. 

Must go! I could eat here every night. Everytime I visit San Fran I am going to make sure I come here.
author: Marisa M.

description:
Nice place to try for a special occasion.  We sat on the second floor, which was quite cozy and dark.

We started off with the Crispy brussel sprouts app, which I quite liked.  It was tasty and crispy, although the yogurt provided became a bit overwhelming towards the end.  For the entree I had the Roasted chicken breast.  The chicken itself was a bit dry, but the spicy sauce and the herbed spatzles were a nice complement and was tasty.  We finished off with the Strawberry rhubarb eclair, which was a bit too sour for me.

Overall, it was all right.  Personally, I didn't have high hopes since the menu was so limited.  There wasn't anything in particular I wanted to try, but my dining partner wanted to come here.  It fell below her expectations, so I doubt we'll be back.
author: Karen L.

description:
I had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on my birthday, with my husband, after a concert. It being after a concert, we had reservations for 11:15pm, fairly late.

   We arrived, the place was quite. There were only two other couples. A pleasant dim lit ambience that was very inviting. We were seated upstairs in a little loft area, right above the kitchen. 

   I was pleasantly surprised that we didn't feel rushed at all by the staff, as our reservation was fairly late, just 45 minutes before they closed. 

  The gentlemen that served us was quite pleasant and efficient. He noted it was my birthday and when he brought our dessert had put a candle in my dessert item. 

  All of our food was amazing. The food was visually beautiful and tasted delectable. My salmon entree was fabulous! What a great piece of fish, perfectly crisp skin and seasoned to perfection. 

   My husband's food was equally good. We both also order little bites, entrees, and desserts. 

    I would say we were both most pleased with our whole experience. We would definitely return and recommend this place. It's open fairly late as well, which is a plus. It's hard to find a nice restaurant on the late night.
author: Krista B.

description: Intimate setting, spectacular food, friendly and courteous staff all around the house.  If you can get a table at a decent hour jump on it!
author: Matthew D.

description: Horrible restaurant. Customer service is terrible. Ordered a $55 meal that tasted horrible. The fried frog legs were fried in a breaded batter that was soggy and salty. They served a$34 lamb chop plate where there was no meat on the 2 chops that come on the rack! Instead of offering an apology or other options. We were given a check and dismissed. Highly overrated. Well over priced Bad enough to make me swear off san Francisco for a while.
author: Khira T.

description:
We had Dinner at this very small & narrow restaurant with 7 tables, based on Yelp reviews. We were told  the first night with a new menu.
The food was good, but not memorable.  We had Pain De Campagne or bread with butter and sea salt. Perrier water $ 6, The 3 Rib Rack of Lamb was paired with a cold chickpea salad which by it self was good, but not the best pairing with the lamb at $42, Pork Tenderloin with chantrells mushroom was very good $28, French Red wine Chateau Belevue Figea $15, and desserts Le Petit $14, La Tarte $11.

The waiter was attentive.
 Overall food was good, but would not eat there again. Have had much better.
author: Phil S.

description:
As usual, the service, atmosphere and the food were second to none as my wife and I visited Bouche.  With the lamb as an appetizer and the steak and salmon as our main courses, everything was delicious absolutely delicious.  

I have dined at Bouche over a half dozen times and I have yet to enjoy a meal that wasn't prepared to perfection!
author: Rick D.

description:
One of my favourite restaurants in SF
Food is amazing and looks beautiful
Staff is very friendly - unless you're obnoxious, and then they're still more accommodating than I would be
Love this place and hope they continue for many years to come
author: Kevin P.

description: This restaurant tries to scam customers by putting an automatic gratuity of 20 percent and claiming customers who spend above 200 dollars automatically gets charged this amount.  This is the biggest bonehead trick I ever seen a restaurant in SF pull.  Food was mediocre,  appetizer was below average.  Space very crowded.
author: Justin H.

description:
Absolutely delightful cosy 2 story bistro that evoked memories of our wonderful visits to Paris, complete with the most charming French staff who so politely listened to my version of French.  Lively counter seating downstairs with the kitchen in view, quieter intimate upstairs flanked by open windows which was perfect for our date night.  My first visit.  Hubby visited before with a couple business guests.  Very conveniently located next to the Sutter-Stockton Garage.

A well thought out, seasonal and focused menu that was solid, sprinkled with creative touches.  Every dish hit the mark.  Delicious, excellently prepared, and 2 dishes with added foie gras option... yuuum, yes, please.  Even dessert - Hubby, who usually avoids sweets, raved about this one.  The waiter was very knowledgeable about the wines, and paired our food with an excellent bottle.  Can't wait to come back!

Appetizer:  Grilled Confit Lamb Belly, added foie gras
Mains:  Roasted Pork Tenderloin and Char Grilled Hanger Steak, added foie gras
Dessert:  Cheese Special and Creme Fraiche Custard, Dulce De Leche
author: Lola K P.

description:
Fries 5/5
Brussel sprouts 5/5
Chicken 3/5
Salmon 5/5
Ahi tuna 4/5

Service 4/5

Ambiance 4/5

I would definitely come again!!!
author: Elease A.

description:
This place is amazing. Usually restaurants will blow me away on their apps or desserts and disappoint when it comes to the entrees, but Bouche delivered on ALL their courses.

The space is small and cozy. Like everyone mentions, it feels like you are going into a small, cozy home from the 1920's, complete with an old school rotary phone near the entrance.

We sat upstairs by the window, but I wished we were by the railing so I could look over the kitchen.

RESERVATIONS: We had a reservation for 4 people at 5:30pm on a Saturday, made a month or two in advance online. Otherwise, with the limited seating, there most likely would have been a wait!

MUST-HAVES: Panisses, Hanger Steak, Seared Swordfish (I was completely blown away by this Swordfish!).

DISAPPOINTMENTS: Fougasse (it wasn't bad by any means, but for all the hype and for $8, it didn't feel worth the price nor the stomach real estate for me).

See my photos for additional details on the food!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Everything was great, very impressive wine selection. Upstairs space is so small that we could almost hear what all the other tables are talking about, but it didn't bother me at all. 

Will definitely go back for the steak.
author: Eve M.

description: We came in on a whim, walking by around 6:45pm, glanced at the menu to see a vegetarian risotto. It was absolutely delicious risotto, savory with just enough crunch to the veggies. Seating downstairs is charming with artistic interior decor, bar stools only. Upstairs is reservation seating. The food came quickly, and service was great. Definitely a spontaneous delight.
author: Gaya G.

description:
Pretty much every time I make it back to San Francisco I work out a stop here, whether alone or in company.  The food's just really really good, no nonsense but super quality.  They're also very forgiving about my attempts to keep up my French.

Every time I've been the menu's been different, which I appreciate as well.  The choices are usually fairly limited, allowing them to really focus on making all of the choices work really well.

This is clearly a romantic hot spot as well, but I'm always very happy to dine there by myself and observe people passing by outside or inadvertently listening in on conversations equally.
author: Thomas V.

description: Had the bacon bread, crispy Brussels and the pork chop with foie jus ... the wine, service and overall ambiance just took it all over the top. Great people on staff. One of my favorite dining experiences. So good.
author: Jason S.

description:
Cozy, charming dinner getaway with French classics executed well. Delicious dishes, intimate ambiance, excellent service. Enjoyed celebrating an anniversary and could not be happier with our dinner. Each dish we ordered shined its own right - the well-loved chick pea fries, hanger steak and creme fraiche custard did not disappoint.

$12.00 Panisses, chick pea fries - delightful savory snack, lightly fried, enough to share for 2.
$16.00 Greens salad with watermelon radishes, curds, nicely dressed with Green Goddess. Tasty, super fresh, well-balanced flavors and textures. Excellent starter.
$30.00 Seared salmon, grilled yellow wax beans, black lentils, beurre blanc - am spoiled by outstanding salmon being from Seattle, but this was flavorful, tender and juicy. Perfectly done.
$30.00 Chargrilled hanger steak, crispy smoked potatoes, royal trumpet mushrooms, black garlic crème fraîche, espresso jus - all smoky everything! Love a good hanger and the smoked potatoes with trumpet mushrooms gave excellent meatiness to this dish. Hearty, not heavy. 
$10.00 Creme fraiche custard, dulce de leche - was very skeptical as I typically don't enjoy pot du creme type desserts but this blew me away, could not resist enjoying another spoonful. 

Recommend dinner for date night or special occasions. Reservations recommended as the restaurant seats 15-20.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Update: 

Still delicious. 4.5 stars! I'm taking off half of a star because of price and bar seats. 

Ambiance 4 stars: was nice, I ate downstairs, which had natural lighting. I came in, and was immediately offered to sit anywhere I like, and given a menu. I went on a Tuesday at 7:00pm, crowded, but comfortable. 

Service 5 stars: great! Prompt! If I was sitting and enjoying myself the server left me alone, the second my head popped up or a dash was empty, he would come right over to check on me. 

Food 4.5 stars: marinated hanger steak was exactly what you'd expect from a nice French restaurant, nice gentle marinade with a little salt and pepper on the outside before cutting. Steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The whipped potatoes and roasted onions really shined! The bone marrow bordelaise was good, not too salty, no lumps, a good compliment to the dish, but it wasn't something I was licking off the plate. $30

Dessert: custard and caramel cream, everything the menu described, just wasn't my cup of tea... $10

Parking garage and very little street parking available! Overall, 4.5 stars and I'll definitely come back!
author: Kortni S.

description:
This place was damn fantastic!  We stopped in before heading to see Seal sing w the SF Symphony back in November and we were blown away!  

We shared 3 dishes: the amazing brussel sprouts, the risotto which was especially bomb and the hanger steak.  We were wow'd.  Everything  was delicious and fabulous and succulent and cooked to perfection.  The ambience upstairs was romantic for this romantic date.  The wine and champagne went down easy. The wait staff were kind.  

I highly recommend this quaint traditional French restaurant!  Beautiful food, surroundings, and people!
author: Marya G.

description: Omg this place is amazing. The bacon bread, the steak, the dessert, it was all amazing. I took my parents for their anniversary and they loved it and they are a really hard sell. Will return!!
author: EliZabeth B.

description:
Favorite French place in town!
Guillaume the owner and Chris the chef are always going to surprise you in the plate and in your glass with a great menu and wine list! The food is delicious and The waiters are all super nice and they will take a really good care of you! 
I love it!
author: Geraldine F.

description: This is a hole in the wall place with great food. Very small so reservations are a must. So glad we happened onto this restaurant. The food was rustic classic French and amazing.
author: Mark G.

description: Very impressive. Cozy yet enough room that we weren't sitting on top of other patrons. The Fougasse (or bacon bread) was amazing. The apps and entrée were the perfect blend of flavors as only the French can do. I would definitely go back and recommend.
author: Giuseppe E.

description:
Environment: This is a cute little french restaurant that has a small bar area downstairs and some additional seatings on the second floor by open windows. The environment itself was intimate, with candle-lit tables within a small space. However, reggae music was being played, which cracked me up, so not the most romantic place.

Food: Complementary bread, and the waiter did ask if we wanted more. With two people, we tried the pork belly appetizer and each got the hanger steak. The pork belly was delicious and so well prepared. It wasn't a large portion, but the plating was very well done. The runny egg yolk had some kind of spice on top, but it made the perfect dip for the pork belly. I'm not even a fan of pork belly, but this is something worth trying. The hanger steak was delicious as well. I get mine medium rare, and it was chewy and pretty flavorful. The portion was decent. It comes with some grilled romaine lettuce ( i think) and amazzinngglyy prepared red potatoes. 

Service: The waiter was fast to take orders, fill our cups up with water, and even switched out our utensils between courses. Don't bother making small talk with him though, he's not interested. But hey, he gets the job done so thanks
author: Cindy H.

description:
I made reservations for labor day weekend and it's a good thing I did since the restaurant had very little seating upstairs. The ambiance is quite romantic, but it was also quite dark.

I specifically chose this restaurant because it still sells foie gras and I wasn't disappointed. The foie gras was so soft and very high quality. 
Also ordered the marinated hanger steak and that was also tasty. Meat was tender and the bone marrow jus was so flavorful. 

Service here was excellent since there weren't many tables and our waiter could provide more personal attention. One thing I noticed was the downstairs area is much brighter, but also mostly bar seating.
author: Edward W.

description:
I was hyped up before even entering this restaurant and was not disappointed. 

My boyfriend and I spontaneously decided to have dinner here. We were worried we would not get seats but were pleasantly surprised to have been seated near the front of the restaurant in the corner near the window. It was very San Francisco! I loved everything about this place: the atmosphere, the food (omg the food!), the service! It was fantastic from start to finish. 

Although it was a packed house and clearly they were busy, our waiter was attentive and constantly checked on us and poured us water when our cups were empty even though we could've done it ourselves. He has exceptional recommendations for food and wine pairings. 

We started off with the lamb belly and each had the hanger steak with added on foie gras. The belly melted in your mouth and the steak could be easily cut by a butter knife. We truly enjoyed every bit especially the foie gras (our favorite)! For dessert we had the eclairs which were not overly sweet but just right. 

It was such a sweet, intimate, romantic date night. Highly recommend. Just be prepared to wait! Or make a reservation.
author: Marie N.

description:
Dinner review. 

Bacon bread - 3/5
Grilled confit pork belly (corn bread, Roquefort, balsamic reduction, figs) - 3/5
Chicken breast (foie gras jus) - 3/5
Marinated hangar steak (bone marrow jus) - 3/5
Angel food cake (pluot, toasted fig leaf, Candied walnut) - 3/5

Overall, "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: Great ambiance. Took a star off because they ran the A/C like there was no tomorrow and I did freeze a bit up in the loft. My chicken was a dry too. On the plus side, the wine pairings the waiter recommended were great and the bacon bread is not to be missed!
author: Jenna D.

description: Great food and very tasty appetizers. Almost all dishes we tried were innovative, unique and with a strong great taste. Fois Gras was so unique and must try and even the sprout was amazing. Overall, great experience and will definitely come back to try more dishes. Thanks
author: Reza F.

description:
Looking for a French restaurant and decided on Bouche. Good choice. French-sized portions (just what we wanted!), fast and friendly service, good food and wine, and my wife loved the desert! (Eclare with hibiscus and fruit.) Typically French sweetness (which means 1/2 the sugar of American deserts).

A cozy, intimate place, we sat in the second level. Ordered cumin-encrusted ahi, and hangar steak with foigras. Yummy, although a neighbor ordered his steak med-well, which killed it and he didn't like it. Seems he wasn't very educated about French cuisine or how the characteristics of meats change when over-cooked.

We enjoyed our meal and desert, and consider this place a "keeper."
author: P S.

description: Relatively inexpensive and did a great job with food. Place is pretty small dure has a a really intimate feel. Perfect for a date night. Will return to keep exploring the menu!
author: Ulysses P.

description:
This place is awesome!

1. Reasonably price 
2. Tasty foods and desserts 

Staying with my sister in SF and we walked here for dinner.  Very cute place.  Service is a bit distracted but it's a small place, casual, and very charming.

We tried the bacon bread, foie gras, pork belly, salmon, flank steak, cream type dessert, and a fruits with whipped cream dessert.  Got a bottle of rose and a glass of red.  Everything delicious.
author: Kayla N.

description: Perfect spot for a nice date night or intimate birthday for two ... swordfish was perfect. The Sancerre was in point for both the hanger steak and the swordfish... enjoy! I cannot wait to go back and see what is new on the menu!.... ps the bacon bread is worth every penny
author: Tim O.

description: I had the hanger steak and it was extremely delicious. It's a real wonder what these guys can do in the teeny tiny kitchen they have! We had the Brussel sprouts and a salad to start and they were pretty good, nothing special. Gotta give them 5 stars on the main course because it really did shine in my opinion. I hope more people check this place out and they expand their menu a little!
author: Simon R.

description: Amazing find! Tiny kitchen and small menu with big flavors! Great French speaking service with some attitude.
author: Ari B.

description: Celebrated friends 50th last night , first time eating here . It was amazing , food was excellent and service was great ! New fave restaurant. I was blown away by the Pork Milanese's, and the deserts were insanely good as well . Highly recommended !!!
author: Peter M.

description:
Ummmm no words. 
5 stars because this place is:
Delicious
Slept on
Open late
Holy shit

Nuff said
author: Cassio Z.

description: Really loved the feel of Bouche. Intimate and warm in every way. Menu was a bit too limited in my opinion. I understand keeping it small due to the size of the establishment, but it would've been nice to have a couple more entrees to choose from. The chocolate eclairs were shit dry though. Come on, guys. If you're going to charge this much per head, execute the damn menu- especially when it is this limited. That's just unacceptable. Food was very tasty otherwise and service was up to par. Meal was paced very nicely.
author: Michael L.

description:
We had a reservation at 9 for a friend's birthday and we didn't get seated until 20 minutes after. We all ordered steaks and it took an hour to come out. 

We saw parties that came after us get their food first and leave before us.

When the steaks finally came out, they were initially lukewarm and then cold and it felt like they had been forgotten about and left out for awhile.

There was no apology or update on food or anything. I try to not ask and be nagging, but I had to check in with them twice for where our food was.
author: Toni T.

description: I was really excited about this place. The presentation and preparation was great...  But everything lacked flavor. My favorite part of the meal was dessert.
author: k.d. w.

description: The venue is a tiny, candle-lit two-story structure with rustic, wooden furniture and beautiful wall accents. The food is delicious. The wine selection is varied. It can get a bit noisy, so not ideal for those seeking an intimate discussion over dinner. What makes this place worthy of a five star, however, is Julie. She elevates the experience and taste with her quick service, wonderful smile and overall delightful demeanor. The French accent doesn't hurt, either. Will definitely be going back. Reservations are strongly recommended, though a walk-in may still be possible right when they open.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Flavors, quality were fine. Portions smaller and pricier than other San Francisco French restaurants; what sets Bouche apart from the others is their poor, inattentive, dismissive service.
author: TL R.

description:
Quaint French cuisine in a very small space.  This bistro and wine bar is located in Lower Nob Hill. It was easier for us to walk 1.5 miles from China Basin rather than attempt to ride evening traffic. 

Since we had a party of 5, we were seated upstairs. The food and wine selections were exquisite. We tried every appetizer on the menu. Entrees were evenly split between the hanger steak, halibut, and chicken. Every entrée was cooked to perfection. So don't be fooled by the limited menu. The portion sizes even leave room for dessert.
author: Patricia N.

description: Food was great. Beer was good. Location was fantastic. Will go back for sure. Upstairs has a good view of the city.
author: Otto T.

description:
I am beside myself with how good this place is.  We arrived in SF late and almost too late for dinner at just about anywhere.  Kitchens were closing - no food to be found.  Opentable squeezed in a reservation for us and this tiny little spot cranked out some of the best food I've had in my entire life.  Everyone there was super nice.   Very professional - the unique breed of people that you meet on rare occasion.  Very knowledgable and the food was amazing. 

This is the spot to go if you're tired of snobby SF.  

If you're reading this - thank you again for being so accommodating.  We'll be back:)
author: Fernet B.

description: Excellent. Dinner w/my son at this little french bistro felt authentic and food was delicious, I had brussel sprouts and salmon w/lentils. Prepare to spend some $$, but well worth it. Good french wine list, we had the Le Charmel rose, perfect w/my fish and my son's risotto. I'll be back, 2 thumbs up.
author: Anita W.

description:
Nice little spot we found while trying to find somewhere to eat when we couldn't decide what to eat. We ordered the pork belly, pickle platter, and bacon bread for appetizers. The pickle platter was pickled peppers, onions, and cucumbers. Some of them were very spicy so be warned. It also came with toast and a chorizo spread that was pretty tasty. I really enjoyed the bacon bread and would recommend ordering. For an entree I ordered the waygu beef which was delicious. Very tender! It came with beans and pickled onions with a balsamic sauce. It tastes really good with everything together. As for drinks I ordered the Lirac which I very much enjoyed. 

For dessert we ordered the custard that came with a dulce de leche sauce that was amazing. This dessert elevated my review from 4 to 5 stars. The custard had a little salt on it that was so delicious when combined with the sauce. 

Service was excellent! At the end of our meal the waiter brought out a glass of wine for my girlfriend and I which was very nice. It was a very sweet and an excellent dessert wine.

Overall this is a good restaurant I recommend trying. It is very small intimate place for a romantic night out. I only wish I could have sat upstairs.
author: Justin C.

description: Cozy, romantic little French restaurant good for date nights. Friendly service and good food. Can't go wrong here.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Excellent on every level. On vacation and this place was close. Glad we tried it. Bacon bread is memorable and so was the risotto. The deserts were out of this world. Dulce de Leche stole the show
author: Clement H.

description:
A quaint establishment near Chinatown. 

Came here on a Sunday night and it looked pretty packed, so recommend reservations, however, we were seated fairly quickly. 

We had great service and they were good on timing. We were greeted at the door and the two gentleman manning the place were very friendly. 

We ordered the pickled plate and pork belly as an appetizer as well, as the bacon bread. The pickled plate was a little spicy but we were forewarned. 

We shared the waygu beef and it was paired nicely with the pickled veggies. The beef was cooked perfectly and would order it again. A couple next to us told us to order the poached chicken bc the side tomato salad was why they came back here. Since we already ordered we decided to see how we felt after our meal to see if we would order an additional dish. 

I ordered a glass of their domaine de la mordoree lirac which was a smooth red to accompany the meal. 

If anything order the custard w dulce de leche. I would come here just for their dulce de leche. It was so delicious! 

All in all, it's a nice date night with great food and service and even better company!!! Would recommend.
author: Lindsay D.

description:
Excellent food, excellent service. Watch them sometime because each dish was prepared to order  with attention to detail. The place is small but worth the wait for great food and service. Keep it up guys! I say guys because that's all I mostly see here. 

Got the: 
-Cheese special. Ask them about it and they will tell you a story behind the cheese. 
-My favorite, the lamb, ooh so tender and juicy. The flavor is perfect, not too salty, not too sweet.  
-sweetbread. Good. 


I have yet to try their dessert. Will be back soon.
author: Shamoo S.

description:
My friend took me to this place for my birthday. When we first walked into the restaurant, I was like... Hmmm is this really a nice restaurant that serves amazing food? As all we know, we should never judge the book by its cover! The free was great and I had the best dessert at Bouche that I never had before!!!

We ordered 3 appetizer, but I don't quite remember the name of the dishes. 
  - First dish, it's potato and a half cooked egg, doesn't look fancy but the way they used the spiced and the flavor was just unbelievable!! 
  - Second appetizer, its green peas and some sort of broth. Again, it look super simple but the broth was amAzing!!!
  - last appetizer, we have this dumpling type of food. Great flavor and was delicious.

Our main course was the steak. When they first brought the entree on, I was like, wtf? Literally just three pieces of small cut meat and garnished with some vegetables. But as I took the first bite of the steak with the sauce, it was amazing. The steak literally melt in your mouth and the flavor kept coming back to your tip of tungue. 

Lastly, we had this dessert, it's a pear dish. Not sure how they made it. But I almost don't want to share the dessert with my friends and just want to devour it by myself. 

Overall, great experience and the foods are remarkable!!
author: Jeff H.

description: The duck confit was dry.  Too expensive for the food quality and portion size.  We also felt like we were crammed into a tiny space, so not ideal for date night.  We won't be coming back.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Came here for a girls night with my friend YY. First impression: super small but homey and not really "fancy". However, don't let looks fool you--they have an upstairs seating area where there is a tad bit more space and the food is stellar.

Environment: feels like youre sitting in someone's converted attic. There are only a few tables upstairs (and some bar seating downstairs) and tables are pretty close together. In other words, it's quite an intimate setting. There are windows upstairs to ventilate, but it will get hot inside. So don't wear any sweat-sensitive clothing when you dine here, and/or wear layers that you can remove! Atmosphere is smart casual -- you probably don't want to wear a T-shirt but jeans are probably fine and you won't stick out if you go a bit higher with slacks/skirts/dresses. Men's jacket not required but also ok.

Note that the food is a bit pricey (apps $13+) but the flavor is on point. This time we just ordered appetizers because we weren't too hungry. We got the bacon bread (bacon pieces are literally baked with/inside the bread) which comes with some butter. YY got the carpaccio, which I thought was simple/clean but also very small. I got the pork belly, which was delicious and surprisingly not that small of a dish. Not to say I wouldn't have eaten more of it if it had been a bigger serving.... 

Cute place for a date, but, again, be prepared to be a bit toasty and spend a decent amount of money. It ain't cheap but it's good!!
author: Julia N.

description:
First off, the hostess was abrupt. The waiter mumbled and looked annoyed when I asked if the cheese and butter were pasteurized, despite the fact that I told him I'm pregnant. He had a snooty attitude. Really? That doesn't usually go well with my dinner.

Bread was good, as was the butter.

Chickpea fries were served with a white sauce. I asked if it is pasteurized. He said yes, the mayo is pasteurized. Paused. Then added, but it has raw eggs. Are you effen kidding me? WTF.

The tomato, cheese curd, basil, quinoa salad was wonderful.... But would I go back for a salad? Nah, you know I wouldn't.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
A French restaurant with a rustic and cozy ambience. Since it only has limited seatings, within 30 minutes from the opening at a Sunday night, there were people waiting already. 
I had pork belly with arugula, figs, blue cheese and corn bread. The pork belly was flavorful, but a bit too fatty. My friend ordered the chicken breast with poached egg and grilled cabbage. I took a bite of the chicken and it was really tender! 
For dessert, we had chocolate truffle duo and angel's cake. The truffle came with two flavors: pineapple with cardamon and brandy. I couldn't taste much of the brandy, but the pineapple and cardamon flavor is strong and well-balanced!
author: Jennifer F.

description: My friend is a regular here and I can see why she comes several times a month. First off, it's one of the few places that is open until 1 am so you can head there after a play/show. The place is small so reservations are a good idea. We had to change our reservation time more than once and we ended up being early and they were very flexible. I got the yellowtail and steak and both were very good, except the medium rare steak was a little too rare. The steak comes with sides which were delicious. My friends love wine and they trust the waiters here with wine recommendations to pair with the food. They also brought us an extra appetizer- chickpea fried which were really yummy. Service is excellent.
author: Chi P.

description:
Incredible from start to finish! 

Started with a delicious bottle of Rose and a beautiful prawn salad app, which has this vanilla dressing (it sounds weird, but go with me here) that I cannot stop thinking about days later!

Moving into the entree, I selected the hanger steak, which was cooked perfectly and was shockingly tender for what is typically a tough cut of meat.

Treated ourselves to dessert and had a creme fraiche with homemade caramel sauce, plus a cheese plate, and both were so decadent and rich - what a treat!

Bouche is a beautiful restaurant with impeccable service and stellar food - it's truly not to be missed. 

As a side note, I also loved that all of the plates, bowls, etc were handmade by a local artist. They were stunning and just added to the beauty of the entire evening. 

Look forward to coming back on my next visit since the menu changes frequently!
author: Chelsea L.

description: One of the best French meals I've had on any continent. Stellar food and service. Bouche has now taken over the spot as my favorite restaurant in SF.
author: Justin G.

description:
A small intimate French themed restaurant with a chef from Lyons..no..Bordeaux..no..South San francisco...YES!  And what a gem this was.  Small and intimate space..and small and intimate menu that obviously means they're serving what they are good at.
Start with the deserts...Tart of the day was awesome..dark chocolate balls divine..pot de cremes Ok..sheep cheese and honey..wow.  Chef loves simple and flavorful and cheese exemplified this.
Main course standout was yellowfin..first course sweetbreads had the best flavor of the dinner. We brought wine so we didn't review the list but it looked great.
Not TOO pricey for the location, but it's such a small hideaway and the food is so good..we'll be back with more friends.  It's so nice to walk out of a dinner where everyone at the table was raving about the meal.
author: Colloton R.

description:
Perfect place for an intimate dinner for two. This place has great food and service. We were promptly seated and served when we came in. The pork belly and calamari were phenomenal!!! The halibut and the steak were good but didn't compare the the apps we got. I would def come here again with a small group but never a large one. 

Pros:
Food is amazing 
Service is good and attention 
Good union square location 
I loved the plates! 

 Cons:
Restaurant is small so don't expect a very quiet meal
author: Michael T.

description: Another great meal. It's the one place that I throw aside every bit of food pickiness that I have and just fall mercy to the dishes served by this amazing restaurant
author: Evan S.

description:
Had such a great dining experience here last week. They were able to accommodate us, even with our last minute reservation on a Friday night. The place is small, which makes it a very intimate experience. We had to wait awhile once we arrived but they were very attentive to our needs and even offered to open our bottle of wine for us to enjoy. The restaurant and kitchen is smaller but really cute! 

The service is was great. They came around and made sure we were enjoying our food and had everything we needed a couple of times. We order the pork belly and chick pea fries appetisers (both were amazing), the steak, and pork loin. Everything was cooked to perfection. For dessert, we ordered the creme fraiche custard, which was really rich and delicious.

5 stars for service, food, and experience!
author: Katarina D.

description:
Yelp is showing wrong hours for this place!!!!!!!!!! The correct hours are :

Tue - Sat  (05:30 PM - 01:00 AM)
Sundays 05:30PM - 11:00 PM
author: Ali A.

description: The Brussel sprouts are to die for! Highly recommend this place to anyone in town. The service is outstanding too!
author: Daphni H.

description: We woke up at 10pm and she said "feed me."   Where do I take a foodie to eat at midnight on a Sat in SF? Bouche is the answer. Cozy upstairs 6 table dining room with Flickering candles?  Bottle of Bordeaux? Pork belly with fennel slaw? Foie gras with chanterelles? Sea Bass with ratatouille? Creme fraiche sea salt with dulce de leche? Think I am going to be lucky!
author: David W.

description: I have lived in the City for 20 years and I have just had the best piece of salmon I have ever experienced ...ever... crazy. Come down and try it. I challenge you foodies..
author: Peter H.

description:
Debbie Downer.  It was okay, I liked the experience, but I won't likely go back.  Honest opinion and against the 4.5 star grain.  Let me explain.

1.  Lower than my expectations, it's a casual bar below (and tiny and open kitchen), and up the stairs in a loft, small 8 table seating.  The feel is if you are in upstairs at someone's house.  True, it was cozy and charming, but not deluxe or upscale in anyway.

2.  The hostess/bartender and the waiter both had heavy French accents, so that was nice.  But dressed very casually in jeans, was again, below my expectations.

3.  It's casual modern French cuisine.  The menu is very small, and does not any feature any traditional dishes, perhaps seasonal or daily, but this menu on this day did not have chicken or beef -- my preferences.  4 apps, 4 entrees.

4.  My order: seasonal greens (shishito peppers, really, French?) were cooked well, but unexciting and far from great (3.0 stars, $8).  Chickpea Fries (panisses) sounds so good, but they were thick and tasted like polenta.  I'll take my fried calories elsewhere (2.0 stars, $8).  The small Spring Salad with pecans and running egg yolk as dressing was interesting but nice (4.0 stars, $10).  The Pork Shoulder was very tender, but I could have used much more of the little bit of side vegies ($28, 4.0 stars).  The salmon was the highlight of the night, caramelized on one side, cooked to perfection ($28, 5.0 stars). The dessert with a big description, was very pretty, tasted as if it was concocted from cool whip ($11, 2.0 stars).

All in all, nice experience but not going back.
author: Randy B.

description:
I was surprised how small this place is, with only  several tables upstairs and a few seating against the wall downstairs. Overall an uneasy seating for us but several items on the dishes we ordered did leave a memorable impression -
1. the spinach & mashed corn that came as a side of the mary's chicken breast and 2. the very crispy skin of the grilled Sea Bass.
author: Winnie C.

description:
Fantastic food, intimate setting, zero lack of pretension. Will definitely be coming back!

We went here for dessert after Tonga Room -- wish we'd come here for the full meal!
author: David H.

description: Last minute reservation got us two seats at the bar. We were well looked after. Had an amazing strawberry rhubarb eclair for desert. Good food choice on limited length menu.
author: Stuart H.

description:
An hour for our main course to be tabled, an obtuse service standard and cold dishes. The six of us could go on and on. This was not an isolated incident and I would not write a review based off one or two visits to a business. 
The front of house staff is generally quite good. Who knows what pandemonium is going on back of house. 
The tragedy of Bouche is that service and dishes are so wildly polar opposites each and every time a party of us dined here. We don't understand that this can be a winner of an eatery with so much going for it. Inconsistency is their Achilles Heal. We hope things improve and may try again later in the year. Please get it together - you have so much to work with and be great.
author: Michael G.

description: It's been almost 8 months since I was at Bouche. I couldn't write a review before due to my bad experience there. Long story short, my boyfriend broke up with me here. Besides the heart break at the end, the meal and wine were excellent. The waiters were friendly and the ambience of the place was quaint and beautiful. I won't ever go back due to the bad memory forever associated with this restaurant, but you should all still go for the great food. Hope your evening turns out better than mine.
author: Thai L.

description:
Was in town and wanted to meet up with an old friend I had not seen in a couple years. We both agreed that the Union Square area would be the perfect middle point and I did a quick search to find this joint nearby. I had been craving some French food as it has already been 5 months since I was in paris for the euros (how time flies). Made a reservation on open table for 7 PM on a Tuesday night. The joint itself is very quaint and unassuming from the outside. 

As soon as you step in, there is a sense of warm that comes over you with a very welcoming aurora. There is a bar right as you walk in and a few spots there as well as a table. The main dining room is on the second floor of this place and there are a few tables up there making it a very enjoyable atmosphere. I was a huge fan of the rustic feel and an even bigger plus was these folks speaking French and dealing with my poor French . Definitely made me feel like I was in a Parisian bistro vs on the streets of San Francisco. The servers were all friendly and joking with our table which I appreciated. The wine list here is on point as well so I was a fan of putting back a few vinos even though I had just wrapped up whiskeys at an earlier bar (yes it was slightly rough the next morning.#lifedecisions). We both looked at the menu and as she wasn't hungry and I am on a weird keto diet, we kept it simple by just ordering entrees. I really wanted to try a few of the appetizers but CURSE MY DIET to the high heavens. But I digress, I decided to go with the pork loin which came out promptly. I am not traditionally a huge pork loin fan but I have to say this one was solid all around. I was a bit concerned that they were going to overcook it but it ended up being tender and tasty. I was just going for a protein meal cos of the diet but I think the other entrees would have been more delicious based on what my counterpart was eating. 

All in all, I think a solid place for atmosphere, service, and for the food that I had at least. Definitely worth a shot.
author: Dan M.

description: Exquisite!! Beautiful plating and perfectly cooked salmon. The cooking staff was super relaxed, and the fancier French vibe was paired with soft 80s tunes. Will definitely come back :
author: Alyssa K.

description:
We arrived at Bouche on a slow Thursday night. We were seated upstairs, where we were the only guests at the time. For some reason, it was incredibly loud upstairs even though all the action was happening downstairs. I couldn't figure out why. 

It took somewhat of a while to get the dishes, but they didn't disappoint. First off, pork belly confit. The veg was fresh and very flavorful. Especially the mushrooms from Oregon. Everything ate well and ended up being very well seasoned. 

Next up, the vegetarian dish. Now, I'm not actually vegetarian, but I was feeling like trying something new, so this is what I got. Again, just like the previous dish, the veg was incredibly fresh. Great color, great texture. 

The service was good. The young man that helped our table was attentive and friendly. I just wish the dishes came out a little quicker, but hey, while on vacation things should not be rushed.
author: Mark M.

description: Such good food! We had a fabulous night. The place itself is so cosy and sweet. You could think you are in France. Great diner. Bravo et merci, we will be back.
author: Anne P.

description:
Bouche is casual and unassuming, yet elegant and intimate. The perfect place to take someone on a date. Oh, and the food is delicious too!

All dishes were great but my favorite is the salmon, which was seared to perfection. Crispy skin on the outside, soft, tender, and slightly rare on the inside. And though I'm not usually a big fan of venison, which can taste very gamy, I found the venison here to be quite delicate and exquisite.

One thing to note is that all dishes are very affordable, and they're not stingy with their portions either. Ordered two appetizers, two entrees, and a dessert which cost less than $100. Fine dining quality food, without the fine dining prices. Yes please!
author: Allan S.

description:
Stopped by on Labor Day weekend and we were trying to call around to get last minute reservations since we failed to plan :/ Lucked out and they had some space at their itty bitty bar space (the whole place was tiny so no surprise that their bar is too) up front... beggars can't be choosers.  We took it.

We felt obligated to order the bacon Fougasse but it was pretty disappointing but the rest was ok (tho somewhat salty) ---- just wash it down w some wine.  Atmosphere and service were good.  Nothing memorable to necessarily have me running back but i wouldn't decline if invited either ;P
author: Mimi D.

description: I just love this place  the food is amazing, the service is amazing. I called on a saturday to make a reservation for the same day in the evening and they took us in i was surprised there were tables available since they are always full! The got there on time like 1 minute early and our tables was ready, we order drinks, food all at the same time and everithing came put right on time, we never felt like they were rushing us. We order the salmon, steak, risoto, lamb all were good. for dessert we did not like the chocolate cake i think is to dense to heavy, but maybe if you love chocolate you will like it.
author: Doris F.

description: Great great great small french restaurant.  Great ambiance, great service, great food.  Brussels sprouts super. The salmon was perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the tuba even though the portion was small, it was good
author: Morris H.

description: Very cozy.... It was a fun night as we celebrated a friend's  50th birthday! Would recommend definitely to others! I enjoyed my confit lamb belly!
author: Harold J.

description: Cozy little french bistro. Short menu (which is great for me, always a beef, vegetarian (though not vegan) option, fish, etc) with lots of great choices.
author: Holland M.

description:
3.5 STARS for food
2.0 STARS for excruciatingly slow service

Alot of the delicious looking food photos on Yelpare no longer on the menu - check their online menu before you go.
author: Jess C.

description: We had a lovely Valentine's dinner at the bar. As always, the ambience was charming; the food delicious and the service exquisite! Thank you, Guilliame and Matt. And the rose lasted two weeks!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
A little jewel of a French restaurant. Incredibly talented chef who imparts a very creative touch to classical French ingredients. Each dish was superb! I have eaten at much more expensive restaurants, including in Paris, and not eaten as well...

Don't know how they manage such magic in the tiny, open kitchen!  

The restaurant is small...be sure to make reservations.
author: Kate G.

description: Intimate restaurant, with cozy ambience. The salmon and lentils was fantastic-best salmon I've had. My husband had an amazing hanger steak.  Wine selection is perfect.  Seats approximately 16 upstairs and 10 downstairs, so reservations are a must. We would definitely dine here again. Owners/staff are friendly. Perfect for a special occassion. Truly authentic.
author: Julie K.

description: We ate here at an early time (5:30) on a Saturday and while the food and service were fine the noise level and claustrophobic atmosphere made it impossible to enjoy the meal.  The menu is very limited so you should check that before you go but what we ordered (steak, salmon and chicken) was good.
author: Hank W.

description: Amazing find while wandering around after a show! Not a massive selection but delicious one!  The wine is just as good as the food too and the wait staff knows what there are talking about.  The location is small and cozy and feels relaxed.  It's a bit pricey with entrees averaging $30. I deduct a star based on the fact that I left something there called and left a message the next morning and no call back :(.
author: Kristi R.

description: The place is very small, so make sure not to show up without a proper reservation. There are only 5 or 6 tables for two upstairs. Most have a nice view of the outside, which is nice for people watching the delicious, professionally presented food. To start I had the scallops and I loved it; the scallops were fresh, delicate, paired with melon and edible flowers. For main course I got the Yellowtail tuna, which came with cooked with trumpet mushrooms and an pieces of eggplant. It was good, although not the best tuna I have ever had. Then for dessert we shared the chocolate cake which was POWERFUL, something between a cake and a thick pudding-like consistency. Not a bad experience but considering the restaurant reputation I expected a little more.
author: Marissa J.

description:
This place is not 4 stars. We waited over 10 minutes after being seated to first talk to the waiter. We sat at the bar. The ambiance is nice, music is nice, food is not. The halibut dish was okay, not great. The gnocchi for $26 was appetizer size, about 12 gnocchis, and they were overcooked (soft). The pork loin was overcooked (chewy). The waiter bumped into me while I was seated and didn't apologize and poured water into my glass and it dropped all over the table and he didn't say anything. 

We were super nice and polite when we were in there, this is not a tirade by an angry person. Just trying to let everyone know that this was not a pleasant experience.
author: Chris F.

description:
An excellent French restaurant nestled on a quiet street by union square.  Great service and hospitality and the staff couldn't be friendlier. No frills about the seating as it's a small room with a bar and stool set up where you dine in a ledge.  

The steak was my pick and excellent
author: Nadi F.

description:
The food here is salty. 

How salty? Almost as salty as Kobe Bryant watching LeBron in the Playoffs right now lolol

It's always tough when i pay a lot for a meal and the restaurant gives me back a lot of sodium in exchange. 

Maybe it's my fault. After all, I didn't know what half the things on the menu were. I just looked at the description for the one word that I knew and I ordered it.

*french, french, DUCK Confit, french, french*

"Ooo, duck! Let's get that!"
 I exclaimed, not knowing that the description probably translated to:

*salt, sodium, Duck Confit, more salt, more sodium*

I made the same mistake with the Lamb, the Scallops and the Tomahawk Porkchop...

Anyway, the Duck Confit came and we were in shock because it looked like 3 meatballs from Ikea. I didn't expect to get an entire duck with it's beak, feathers, and everything, but I sure as heck wasn't expecting 3 meatballs. 

Shame one me for not paying attention in my French 1 class. The more accurate translation of the description was probably something like this:

*salt, sodium, Duck Confit, not really, just ikea meatballs*

Oh well, you win some and you lose some. We gained an increase in blood pressure (from sodium) and lose some serious dough (the 3 meatballs weren't cheap)

But the ambiance was great (Oh so romantic). And our server was really nice (Kept saying something about 'we' and 'mercy'?). Oh, oh ,oh, and the wine that our server recommended was very, very good. (unless i was just thirsty from the salt lol)

This place is open until 1am, so maybe I'll come back...

"Welcome to Bouche, are you here for a drink or for salt...pardon me, I mean dinner." -Nice Server

"Just wine, just wine, sil vous plait."
author: Ringo M.

description:
Bouche offers a quaint and charming decor that also exudes an essence of coziness with its petite-sized dining.  You would have to make reservations to this tightly knit space, unless you want to wait for an excruciating long time to try this place out.

We ordered up their Bacon Fougasse as a starter and the bread was soft and warm.  Add the bacon bits and it made the bread seem as if it was a homely offering.

Their voluminous and delicious scallops were grilled and flavored with perfection!  The softness and creaminess of the Tarragon Polenta that was tucked right below the scallops, went fabulously well together!  I couldn't get enough of it!

As for their Lamb Shank, the roasted almonds and couscous, added the hard and soft textures to the whole entree.  This dish fared well with our red wine the most!

Another entree ordered up: Pork chop, walnut and quince marmalade grape in cognac sauce.  I liked the pork chop and was cleaning the bone.  That's my habit and I loved the flavor.

Wine Nimez ran its compliments and went well with the courses ordered!  The servers were friendly and accommodating.  It was an intimate evening at Bouche!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
There's not a lot amusing about Bouche. While I'm assuming Bouche is named after the fun tidbits that a creative chef sends out to preferred customers (i.e. "Here's an amuse bouche from the chef."), this little restaurant is stressed out and in search of an identity.

I noted on our reservation that we were celebrating an anniversary. While I wasn't looking for fanfare or anything free, I was surprised when the very first thing the host told us when we checked in is that he really needed our table and provided us with a deadline to be out of the restaurant by. He was obviously stressed and that should have been an indicator of what our Bouche experience would be like. 

But wait, let's take a breath here and take it all in. The restaurant is intimate, cool and romantic. The seating is a little cramped, but really that's part of the charm. The detail work is just great right down to the crown molding finished with newspaper as wallpaper that catches the eye. This is an enjoyable space and while we were at a table upstairs, I think the wine bar below would be just as charming.

The food is good, but not great. It's sort of like a variety of ingredients in search of a theme. It's not quite French, but more like a creative ADHD chef that has decided to shake up the French palate. The citrus salad as a starter is refreshing and vibrant. There's pink and regular grapefruit, blood orange and a unique dressing that works well with it. The only thing that doesn't work is the peeled lime which is just too over-the-top acidic for the meal. The other starter we had was the "crispy prawns." This one had us scratching our head. The salad around the prawns is wonderful with fresh farmers market lettuce, kiwi, shaved radish and other goodies. That alone would have been great. The actual prawns reminded us of the "coconut shrimp" that was a 1990s signature dish at places like TGI Fridays. It's deep with a think sweet batter that seems completely out of place at this restaurant.

For our entrees, we both had Yellowtail tuna cooked with trumpet mushrooms and Japanese eggplant. This was a dish in search of a theme. The eggplant was way undercooked and rubbery and the tuna smelled and tasted like it had more than a few days out of the water in storage on it. The sauce in some cases had a black inky quality. Also included were Fresno chili slices which provided a little heat and needed flavor, but seemed like a last-minute addition to just add some color to the dish. Overall, it was passable, but not wonderful.

Given the time constraints laid out to us upon arrival, we decided not to stay for dessert and move our celebration to a less stressed out environment. 

In summary, this is a restaurant that takes itself seriously to its own detriment. Let's lighten up and actually have a little fun like your name implies. If you can't amuse yourselves, you certainly aren't going to make it amusing for your customers. Clearly, you intentions are good and even earnest, but it's okay to smile a little and realize that with the theater down the street advertising "Touch Our Junk" for its male strippers that no one on the block should take itself too seriously.
author: Eric W.

description:
This place is hella French.  Like you feel bad not knowing French.  Like you're in Paris and feel like a tourist going in there.  In short, hospitality is not something we felt whilst visiting. We felt like foreigners in our home city.

We waited a bit for our table, and the woman who "greeted" U.S. made us feel like we were imposing for showing up on time.  Sorry lady.  Didn't mean to interrupt your stretch of looking generally dour.

The meal was underwhelming.  My wife had some chickpea fries and an heirloom tomato salad, both were forgettable.  I the steak and it was undercooked, ruined the dish.  For the cost, we felt quite cheated.

I'd pass.  Go to Chez Maman or Chapeau for a friendlier and better quality meal. This place failed on every dimension: food, service, and cost.
author: Saminda W.

description: Absolutely delightful spot, from the cozy atmosphere, to the top-notch wine list, to the inventive and expertly-executed menu, to the friendly and efficient staff, to the handmade ceramic dinnerware. Mains are beautifully composed and plated -- each bite a mosaic of textures and flavors, often holding pleasant surprises (like a grilled head of Little Gem lettuce topped with boquerones and parmesan breadcrumbs, served alongside the hanger steak, that riffed on a Caesar salad theme). The hanger steak was terrific, but the swordfish was out of this world, as was the black garlic puree under the sweetbreads. The fougasse comes in handy for mopping up the exquisite sauces, too. Will definitely have this place near the top of my "must-visit" list the next time I'm back in town.
author: Ken M.

description:
Bouche was a great place to eat. The food was amazing.

Some things to consider when coming:
They are a tiny place and crowded (due to great food) so your table will be in close proximity to another table. 

The staff is French and often speaks French. They are very nice and I experienced great service.

Due to a small kitchen they have a small menu. My fiancé and I shared two of the four entrees available and loved both. My favorite of the night was the hanger steak. They really know how to cook beef.

Unless you plan on getting there right at 5:30, make a reservation. We barely squeaked by walking in at opening time, they miraculously had one table available. It's worth it.

My fiancé loved his wine. They have a great wine selection. 

They don't have an extensive non-alcoholic beverage menu. They have chilled still water, sparkling water, coke, and orangina (which is a French soda that tastes like a mimosa without the alcohol). I tried the orangina and found it refreshing and not overly sweet. 

We were too full to have dessert but again the menu was small with just a few quality items.

Plan on being flexible and you will have an amazing experience in a cute little bouchon.
author: Brittney S.

description: OMG. What a gem right off of Stockton and Bush. This little french gem serves dinner until 1 am...so that's a bonus if you are out enjoying the city till the wee hours. Medi was our server and he was a super cool guy! Gave us great suggestions and was helpful in ordering.  DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE IF YOU ARE IN THE CITY. Exceptional food.
author: Debbie K.

description:
Came here with a friend for a pre-show dinner.  It's a very small and cozy upstairs restaurant with some bar seats downstairs.  They have a nice wine list.

We started with the pork belly as an appetizer; it was done just right, tender and juicy and perfectly seasoned.  I went on to have the pork tenderloin and my friend had the swordfish.  Her swordfish was exceptionally good.  My tenderloin was good if not great...was cooked well but not particularly flavorful.  For dessert we had creme fraiche with salted caramel, a very nice and not too sweet dessert option.

Service was pleasant, not over the top but polite and prompt without being pushy.

Overall a nice place to visit, worth a look if you have theater plans in that area for later.
author: Alan S.

description:
Very disappointed 

Bread must have been 2 weeks old
The soup had no taste at all
And to top it all off:
The waiter tried to add a glass of wine for $13.- to our tap

Never again
author: Frank R. K.

description:
This charming small French restaurant feels like your own secret.  Located on top of the Stockton Tunnel it serves a city clientele .
The romantic interior as well as the city lights will make this your magical evening in town.
French inspired and seasonal food combined with an appropriate wine list will provide much in the way of making your meal tasty and interesting.
The French and knowledgable wait staff are happy to accommodate your every desire.
A true elegant find in downtown San Francisco.
author: Conor F.

description:
The service was totally top notch. They worked with us to make sure our party was happy. They helped with the menu and wine without making anyone feel stupid. 

The real charm was the food. The apps were creative. The main course was amazing. Grilled flank steak cooked perfectly with smoky roast potatoes and grilled lettuce with perfect white anchovies. 

The setting was perfect and the atmosphere was like a small French neighborhood restaurant.
author: Tom S.

description:
I thought this place was just lovely.  Great food, friendly casual service, good wine selection. 

The only thing I would have changed was the view of people taking their dogs out to the bathroom on the sidewalk.  Not the restaurant's fault but next time I'll sit with my back to the window.
author: Julian H.

description:
yummmmmmmy. cute, small restaurant with more tables upstairs and more standing room / casual bar downstairs. small menu (which i prefer. no paradox of choice). chill/romantic atmosphere. the menu changes so i dont know how useful it is to go into detail about my food but...
- bacon bread: pretty good. it's really just bread that tastes like bacon with pieces of bacon.
- this pork belly appetizer: yummm.
- flat iron steak entree: yummm. it's hard for me to say anything else because i'm no food connoisseur... i just like to eat what i like...
- two glasses of red wine. i just asked the waiter for his recommendations. and they were yum.

basically food is yum, service is great (oo0o0o0 waiters with french accents), and place is chill. serving sizes arent big so the food is relatively pricey.

fyi, the marinated salmon, poached egg, and creme fraiche that a lot of people are talking about on yelp isn't on the menu because the menu changes!
author: Annie S.

description: Bouche turned out to be a really good restaurant. The food was expertly prepared and well balanced. The waiter was very patient with us as we moved multiple times and finally settled on the bar. When it came to choosing the wine, the waiter let us try multiple options until we found one that was well suited to everyone's palate. Each plate we got tasted amazing. For appetizers, we tried Lamb belly, crispy brussel sprouts, potatoes and the bacon loaf bread. For our main course, we each went with the hanger steak, which had a bone marrow sauce. It was absolutely amazing! They utilize a charcoal grill to cook some of their plates and you can really tell the difference once you bite into the steaks! I highly recommend you give this place a try. It's small but their dishes stand really tall!
author: Haig K.

description: The food is delicious and the chef is hot. Also, they have great French wine. Don't pass this place up!
author: Anisa R.

description: Always good to stop in here while on vacation. Great service + fantastic flavors and presentation.
author: James C.

description: I would give 6 stars if it was an option, this is our single most favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  We sit on the barstools in the window for the terrific people watching, share a bottle of earthy Pinot Noir and eat the most amazing, artistic food that's clearly made with heart.  I believe I saw the restaurant owner having a conversation with a local resident outside of their front door, then a few moments later he walked out with a container of soup which I can only assume he was delivering to her.  Go here often and please share our wonderful seats in the front window.
author: Vance M.

description: I had a late night birthday dinner after work back in March and I can't believe I didn't Yelp about it then. The details are fuzzy now but the feeling from the experience is still distinct. It's an extremely intimate space (small but with such warmth, charm, and character that small is the wrong word) with very delicious food. It is a little expensive for me but I expected it as I planned ahead since it was my birthday. This was my second experience at Bouche, both of which I arrived after 10:30pm, and I can't wait to have another occasion there again.
author: Paul G.

description:
My friend and I discovered this place with the help of Yelp!  We absolutely loved it, our favourite restaurant find of our time in San Francisco!
Great bustly atmosphere and super friendly welcoming staff......and then there is the food!! The menu is quite small but everything we had was absolutely divine and bursting with flavour, with an extensive and impressive wine list to match!
The hostess is rushed off her feet but somehow just has everything under control. 5 stars from me!
author: Rachael S.

description: Food was good, wine was a bit over priced. Spent almost $100 solo and felt like an outsider the whole time. I get that the whole staff wants to speak "French" but come on folks you're in America and a little courtesy would be nice. Unsure if I'll be back. Au revoir douche.
author: Manny F.

description: The highlight of my meal was the fluffiest, most delicate gnocchi I have ever encountered. But they were combined with other mushy ingredients, over a bed of mush, with mushy sides. In fact, every dish we tried had one fatal flaw that sank them: the fries were unbearably salty, the salad was bland, the soup was gummy, the fish's skin was unbreakable, etc.
author: Brian W.

description: A wonderful French bistro in an intimate setting.  We began with Champagne, the market greens and the lamb confit.  The hanger steak with the added foie gras was superb, as was the risotto.  Desert was eclairs, creme fraiche custard and Calvados.  The service was excellent.  This place was a treat.  Highly recommended.
author: David E.

description:
OK so my husband and I came here this evening.  Such a wonderful place!  Service wa excellent.  
As appetizers we had the pork belly and the foie gras.  The foie gras was better than what we had in France.  Pork belly is our favorite and this was excellent as well.
We shared the hanger steak and again just fabulous!  The staff helped pair the wine and we had a bottle of the Bellevue.  Again they help pair wisely.  (They asked the price range we wanted to pay)
And then we had the most fabulous desert.  We had the peaches and cherries.  So different but not to rich...
I would definitely come again!
author: Meme M.

description:
Definitely my favorite in SF right now. They totally won me over.

I'm already admittedly a Francophile, so I was charmed by the atmosphere. Everyone speaking in French/with heavy French accents. The dimly-lit bar seating downstairs and the few tables upstairs. The tiny kitchen we got to sit in front of and watch the chefs in action and chit chat with them when they got a spare moment. The wonderful waitress we had. (Well everyone was super nice! Never understood why people thought the French were mean.) The different wine selection... all of it.

We kicked things off with the seafood pappardelle app, which had bites of some crazy amazingess. I had been craving sea urchin, so this totally hit the spot. The prawn was strange -- it had this texture I've never experienced before. Everything was delicate and well-executed.

Then we (ok I) quickly decided on the charcuterie plate. AWWW yeah, wild boar pistachio pate, goat cheese chorizo crostini, huge jar of duck confit... The goat cheese chorizo spread especially was a religious experience. Wow.

The chef thought we were going to head towards dessert by this time but I sheepishly said no.. I think we're gonna choose an entree. So we got the lamb loin, which was great with the cold haricot vert salad and warm grilled squash. Refreshing for a lamb dish.

Finally we went for dessert. We chose the goat cheese cake with beet ice cream (how interesting!) but they sent out some creme fraiche panna cotta with some dulce de leche first, those sweethearts. So simple and yet SO GOOD. Heavenly, like the chef said. Then the cheesecake... great twist on the classic and a great pairing.

We sat there munching away for nearly 3 hours. Just the way I like it. We were so obviously into the food that we convinced a couple who just came in for drinks to order a few dishes and a few more glasses of wine too. MMMMMM can't wait to go back!
author: Vivian H.

description: Great and personal date spot with incredible food. The waiter was very informative on everything and helped guide our decisions. The menu is small but the entrees had 2x the amount of food expected. Take your lady here, she will love the small tables and ambiance.
author: Guiseppi M.

description:
ABSOLUTELY loved this place!

I really enjoyed my experience at Bouche. It is renowned in San Francisco for delicious French food and exceptional service. Bouche is not an every night kind of restaurant, but great if you are looking to celebrate something special. Be sure to make reservations in advance. 

I would describe it as intimate, charming and cozy.  Feels like a small cafe in Paris. The waiter barely spoke to us - I'm not sure he spoke English but the food was excellent

There menu consists of all things French. We started off with some drinks at the bar, which we took to our table once it was ready. I started off with seared scallops as appetizer- absolute perfection, nice crisply seared and tender. The Fricassée Of Chanterelle Mushrooms, and the Cauliflower Roasted Garlic Custard were so good as well, though the portions were a bit small. 

Overall, my experience at Bouchwas great. It certainly lived up to the hype. From the french baguette to the pronounced accent of the waiter, you really feel like you're getting an authentic French experience!
author: Pablo R.

description: hands down my favorite restaurant in SF. Guillaume and the crew have an eye for details, delicious flavors, and ambiance. Bravo!
author: Cyril N.

description:
This is a secret gem in the middle of the city! Lovely and cozy restaurant. It is a small place but definitely represents French culture. The menu varies from time to time but it is phenomenal. 

It is great for a date night, nice ambience, perfect lighting for a romantic dinner.
author: Lynette P.

description: Food and wine was good; the ambiance bohemian and romantic.
author: Nick J.

description:
We had our first meal at Bouche last night. Nice food, pleasant service although a little rushed. But:

- The menu is small - only four starters and four mains 
- The upstairs dining room, where we were seated, was almost unbearably warm. I'm not sure why - the north-facing windows were open, it was a pleasant night. Even taking off my long-sleeved shirt and eating in my t-shirt, I was too hot. 

Between the overly-efficient service and wanting to get out from the heat, we spent slightly under an hour there. It felt rushed. Perhaps not related, but it seemed that other diners were in and out pretty quickly, too. 

So, good meal but still a very unpleasant experience. As we were exiting the restaurant, we noticed that downstairs seemed way more comfortable, but it has only bar seating.
author: David G.

description: I had a good experience at Bouche. We got our table in the upstairs area, which outlooks to Bush street. The staff are wise about wine and their food, the chefs are engaged and creative. The bone marrow tapenade is an excellent choice for an appetizer, and we also enjoyed the squash napoleon and the cod dishes as main courses, rounding off the night with a cheese platter.
